p:
Rising incomes have led to an increase in per-capita annual alcohol consumption in Indian adults (those 15 years and older), from 1·8 L of pure alcohol in 2000 to 4·3 L in 2010 and 5·6 L in 2016.
165 In 2016, nearly 53·5% (39·1% of men and 68·8% of women) of this age group were lifetime abstainers. The annual per-capita consumption of pure alcohol in current drinkers (aged ≥15 years) was 14·6 L (18·3 L in men and 6·6 L in women). The prevalence of heavy episodic drinking in 2016 for drinkers only (≥15 years) was 44·4% (55·1% in men vs 21·4% in women).
